description: From a series of four etchings for the story "Der Rebell" by Manfred Georg, Heinrich Hochstim-Verlag, Berlin, 1918; close-up of a man's head with large expressive eyes staring straight ahead; there is a black dot between his brows with a black trail of ink running down the side of this nose and cheek; a small hourglass is in the lower left corner
inscription: LL margin of sheet, in pencil: Probedruck. 2. Zustand. E.119-II. / Dr. Rauert | upper center of sheet in pencil, on verso: [illegible] Probedruck. / N. 4 | LLC of sheet in pencil, on verso: 2409
portfolio: From Plate 1 from Der Rebell (The Rebel), Manfred Georg, Heinrich Hochstim-Verlag, Berlin, 1918
signed: LR in pencil, below image: Walter Gramatté / 18. | LL in pencil, below image: Zu Manfred Georg : \"der Rebell\" / (Marsyas)
title: Peter's Head with the Gunshot Wound in the Forehead, Plate 1 from Der Rebell (The Rebel)
